definition: class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.chinese: 自然状态下没有等级制度。

sentences.english: Organizationally, it is the vanguard of a dismantled traditional hierarchy.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司堪称废除传统等级制度的先锋。

sentences.english: He has created a hierarchy largely determined by closeness to the Wu clan.
sentences.chinese: 他以与吴氏关系亲疏建立了一套等级制度。

sentences.english: Yeeyan is step by step building a hierarchy in the community.
sentences.chinese: 译言正逐步在社区里建立等级制度。

sentences.english: That anti-hierarchy and authority of the discourse.
sentences.chinese: 即反等级制度和权威性话语。

sentences.english: Female dogs have a hierarchy, but it's more variable.
sentences.chinese: 母犬有等级制度，但是相对多变的。

sentences.english: These nails are not only the ornaments, moreover is manifesting the feudal hierarchical system.
sentences.chinese: 这些门钉不仅是装饰品，而且体现着封建的等级制度。

sentences.english: The barriers of the old 19th century class system are in many ways being broken down.
sentences.chinese: 十九世纪等级制度的森严壁垒，大都被冲破了。
其他人觉得等级制度太严苛。

sentences.english: Ender watched from the fringes of the group as Bernard established the hierarchy.
sentences.chinese: 安德从外看伯纳德所建立起的等级制度是这样的。

sentences.english: Casteism is a very significant reason for income inequality.
sentences.chinese: 等级制度是收入不平衡一个重大的原因。

sentences.english: The church promulgates hierarchy, which can be seen in all Italian relationships.
sentences.chinese: 教会宣扬等级制度，这在意大利的关系中可以看出来。

sentences.english: The caste system is one where one's parentage determines one's place in society.
sentences.chinese: 等级制度以人的出身决定其社会地位。

sentences.english: Male dogs have a rigid hierarchy.
sentences.chinese: 公犬有一个刻板的等级制度。

sentences.english: They maintain a hierarchy for survival, not for prestige or arrogance.
sentences.chinese: 它们维持等级制度，是为延续生存而非威望和自满。

sentences.english: There is, if you know, a little bit of class system here in England.
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦这里是有一点等级制度的。

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
class division into proletariat and bourgeoisie class enemy, in use esp. during the Cultural Revolution
